intro: Cyrtandra foveolata, commonly known as the Hawaiian false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spurred petals and glandular hairs on its stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Cyrtandra foveolata is an important component of the native flora in Hawaii and is often found in lowland to montane habitats.
